items.sentence: There are a lot of things I need to tell you.
It\'s a waste of time to try to convince Tom.
Tom and Mary were told to stay in their room.
I\'ll always love you, no matter what you do.
I\'m going to be staying at the Hilton Hotel.
I doubt that Tom would ever go out with Mary.
I drank too much and was unsteady on my feet.
I exchanged some yen for dollars at the bank.
I feel much worse today than I did yesterday.
I understand the museum is closed on Mondays.
I unlocked the door and walked into the room.
Tom never worried about how much things cost.
Tom picked up his toys and put them in a box.
I\'m not sure whether Tom can do that or not.
Tom seems to have his mind on something else.
Don\'t pretend you haven\'t thought about it.
Don\'t worry. I know exactly what I\'m doing.
We haven\'t yet been told what we need to do.
We haven\'t yet told Tom about what happened.
I wonder whether or not Tom has shown up yet.
